Private Functions
Functions used internally by a chunk_cache. Do not call these functions directly; use the accessor functions defined in cache.h instead.

Detailed Description

Implements a simple chunk_cache using a slab of allocated memory.

Function Documentation

void cache_slab_empty ( void *  _cache  ) 

Remove all chunks from a slab cache.

Parameters:
_cache A void pointer to a slab cache to empty

void cache_slab_free ( void *  _doomed  ) 

Frees the slab of memory allocated for a slab cache.

Parameters:
_doomed A void pointer to a slab cache to obliterate
Implements chunk_cache.free. Call using cache_free().

chunk* cache_slab_get ( void *  _cache,
int64_t  key 
)

Retrieve a chunk from a slab cache.

Parameters:
_cache A void pointer to a slab cache from which to retrieve the payload
key The position in the slab in which to retrieve the payload
Returns:
The chunk stored at those coordinates, or NULL if the chunk is not present or on error.
Implements chunk_cache.get. Call using cache_get().

chunk_cache* cache_slab_new ( uint32_t  size  ) 

Creates a new slab chunk_cache.

Parameters:
size How many chunks large the slab should be
Returns:
A new chunk_cache, or NULL on error.

int cache_slab_set ( void *  _cache,
int64_t  key,
chunk *  payload 
)

Store a chunk in the slab cache.

Parameters:
_cache A void pointer to a slab cache in which to store the payload
key The position in the slab in which to store the payload
payload A chunk to be stored
Returns:
0 on success, nonzero on error.
Implements chunk_cache.set. Call using cache_set().
